member.name: T:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.PolygonRigidBody
member.summary:
Represents a polygon riged body and acts as base public class for other polygon primatives: rectangle, circle, point.
By default, this object will use the "Relative" collison precision type.
To manually construct this object, set all the properties then call SetGeometry and SetGrid in succession to initialize the collison capability.

summary.para: Body is at the core of the Rigid Body System. It is a RigidBody without the geometry.
The Body handles all the physics of motion: position, velocity, acceleration forces, torques, etc...

list.listheader: The Body is integrated every timestep (which should be fixed) by the PhysicsSimulator in the following manner:
list.item: -Set forces and torques (gravity, springs, user input...)

summary.para: In technical terms, this is known as Symplectic Euler Integration because velocity is Updated prior to position (The reverse of simple Euler Integration)

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.InverseMass
member.summary: The inverse of the mass of the body (1/Mass)

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.MomentOfInertia
member.summary:
The moment of inertia of the body.
The moment of intertia of a body in 2d is a scalar value that represents how difficult (or not difficult) it is to rotate a body about the center of mass.
The moment of inertia is varies by the shape of the body. For basic shapes like circles and rectangles, forumulas exist for computing the moment of interia based on the shape properties (radius of the circle, or length and width of the rectangle)
For bodies that are not basic, it is usually good enough to estimate the moment of intertia by picking a basic shape that is close to the same shape. It is also possible using more advance calculus techniques to compute the actual moment of intertia of non-basic shapes.

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.InverseMomentOfInertia
member.summary: The inverse of the moment of inertia of the body (1/MomentOfInertia)

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.IsStatic
member.summary:
Indicates this body is fixed within the world and will not move no matter what forces are applied.
Bodies that represent land or world borders are a good examples of static bodies.

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.RestitutionCoefficient
member.summary:
The coefficient of restitution of the body.
This parameter controls how bouncy an object is when it collides with other bodies. Valid values range from 0 to 1 inclusive. 1 implies 100% restitution (think of a really good bouncing) 0 implies no restitution (think a ball of clay)
NOTE: In this engine, he RestitutionCoefficient is not the only thing that can cause "bounce" Because of the way collision response is handle (allowing some penetration between objects) fast moving objects may bounce even when their RestitutionCoefficent is set to zero. Hopefully in future versions this can be fixed or at least minamized

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.FrictionCoefficient
member.summary: Controls the amount of friction a body has when in contact with another body. A value of zero implies no friction.

member.name: P:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.Body.LinearDragCoefficient
member.summary:
Linear drag can be thought of as "air drag". The LinearDragCoefficient controls how much linear (non-rotational) drag a body is subject to.
Linear drag causes a force to be applied to the body always in the direction opposite its velocity vector. The magnitude of this force is the speed of the body squared multiplied by its LinearDragCoefficent. force = velocity*velocity*LinearDragCoeficcent

member.name: T:Chimera.Physics.Farseer.FarseerGames.FarseerXNAPhysics.Dynamics.CollisionPrecisionType
member.summary:
Determines how the collision grid is constructed.
If 'Relative', the collision precision will be multiplied by the length of the shortest edge of the geometries AABB. This value will then be used for the grid's cell size
If 'Absolute', the collision precision value will be used directly for the grid cell size.

member.name: T:Chimera.GUI.WindowSystem.ComboBox
member.remarks: Contains a textbox and a listbox, as well as an Icon object, faking an ImageButton. The reason is that they share most of the same code, and without any mouse event handling, it's easier to predict state changes for when list box is open (has focus).

member.name: M:Chimera.GUI.WindowSystem.ComboBox.CleanUp
member.summary: Performs necessary cleanup operations when control is removed from a parent, or when it is no longer needed.
member.remarks:
This method is necessary to ensure references to object are removed, allowing the object to be cleared by the garbage collector.
As such, all event handlers to outside objects such as Chimera.GUI.InputEventSystem should be removed. All controls that have been added will automatically be taken care of, but any UIComponent controls that have not been added, should have their CleanUp() methods called from this method.
